accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A group of letters and a postcard, 1935-1961, written to W. Russell Button of Chicago, Illinois. The collection accompanied a book, Minxes Admonished or Beauty Reproved by Sir William Russell Flint, which was a gift to the Rare Book Collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection was arranged in chronological order by date.

controlaccess.head: Persons:
controlaccess.persname: Flint, Sibylle Suetor Russell, Lady, d. 1960.

did.unittitle: George Arliss, [London, England] to W. Russell Button, Chicago, Illinois, 24 December 1935.

scopecontent.p: Sends photograph to Button's aunt, Mrs. Briggs; is pleased she takes pleasure in his pictures; hopes they can meet the next time Button comes to England.

did.unittitle: Sibylle [Russell Flint], London, [Eng.] to W. Russell Button, Chicago, Illinois, 12 April [19]53.

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for the parcel; has been hospitalized because of a fall and undergoing radio-therapy at Guy's Hospital; wonders if the treatment would help him.

did.unittitle: Sibylle [Russell Flint, London, England] to W. Russell Button, Chicago, Illinois, 29 May [19]53.

scopecontent.p: Will be delighted to see him in July; Willie will be in France from 1 July 'til 18 July; has heard from the Websters about him.

did.unittitle: Sibylle Russell Flint, [London, England] to [W.] Russell [Button], 15 September 1953.

scopecontent.p: Inquires about his health; has been in hospital since March; will see the Gallops next week.

did.unittitle: Sibylle Russell Flint, London [England] to [W.] Russell [Button], n.p., 8 March [19]54.

scopecontent.p: Hopes his arthritis is no worse and that he can "get round the gallery"; here everything is quiet and fears "artists are having a time [sic] [hard?] time"; Willie on the selection committee for the R. A. [Royal Academy] next month; thinks of him often.

did.unittitle: Willie [William Russell Flint], Caernarvon [Wales], to R. B. [W. Russell Button], 18 [September 19]60.

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for his letter of sympathy [on the occasion of Sibylle Russell Flint's death]; Admiral Moore and he are in Caernarvon; thanks him for the color photo.

did.unittitle: [William Russell Flint, London, England] to [W.] Russell Button, Chicago, Illinois, 18 [January 19]61.

scopecontent.p: Expresses admiration for the photographer of the "4 gents"; wishes he [WRB] could have been included; comments on a photograph of him "the Rowlandsonsque representation of your kind self in somewhat Pickwickian attire with wine glass in hand"; has visited Temple Cloud [?] and was shown many paintable subjects in Somerset; spent Christmas with friend Adrian Bury.

did.unittitle: Willie [William Russell Flint], Cairo, [Egypt] to W. Russell Button, Chicago, Illinois, 18 [March 19]61.

scopecontent.p: Has been "gallivanting in Morocco & Libya. Now in Egypt --! too many subjects everywhere."
